three times a week.

The V/Line Capital connection, which connects with the train from

runs through Bombala three times week.

The Monaro highway passes straight through Bombala, connecting from
in the north, to the Princes Hwy in the south across the Victorian border.
There is no public transport or taxi service in Bombala.

The town of Bombala was settled in the 1840's, and was one of the major towns of the region.  It was the terminus for the railway line from Sydney, which has now been progressively closed all the way back to
.  You can still see many historic buildings in the town.  The railway station and lines are still there, and you can walk on the platform.

value: content=The town themes itself as Platypus country and has a platypus reserve around 3km south of the township on the Delegate road.  You will need to be there around dawn or dusk in order to see the platypus.
content=The old bank building has been turned in to a hotel/b&b with five cosy and recently renovated rooms.

is 30 minutes drive away.  You can continue on the road south from there, for a 100km winding and scenic trip to join the Princes Highway.  Great trip for those who love driving corners.  Not so great for travelling with those with a propensity for car sickness.
